review_title: CEO is a great person, and care about the employees
pros: Friendly atmosphere, clean place to work, good opportunity for advancement
cons: Not enough time for lunch, made to wear many hats.

review_title: A great company to work for…. Theoretically…
pros: Great manager, (some) great co-workers, great location in comparison to my house, great small-company feel
cons: Low pay (compared to local hospitals), very little flexibility in hours, not much stability with where you work (constantly floating employees to different floors on the hospital), very old-school policies and practices (always pushing papers around, nothing is wireless), very focused on the day shift and not very understanding of night shift struggles and differences

job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Derby, CT
pros: Great position for someone that thrives in fast-paced environments. Management is generally good with helping and open to questions. I encourage young people to apply as it is a great title for your resume, and you get to develop strong skills.
cons: It is not a great position for the weak of heart. You will come across not so polite people and challanging situations. You will also be completing death paperwork. Of course, you're at a hospital. Don't let this scare you tho.

pros: the pay was okay, but didnt get better
cons: the rrom for advancement was not great

job_title: CRS (Certified Recovery Specialist) in Norman, OK
pros: Pay and benefits are really good
cons: Horrible work environment, shift supervisor is the LPN on duty in the unit. Nobody knows what's going on, patients room are nasty, employees are not properly trained, and they stay so short staffed you practically have to live there cause nobody shows up to relieve you. The conditions in the building are old and not in properly working condition.

pros: Clean, good amenities, great food
cons: Always short handed, long hours for lousy pay employees don’t matter, horrible management. A friend got a job there first day out in training she made a few minor mistakes. Learn from your mistakes don’t make the same mistakes right ... wrong your terminated on her first day

review_title: I regret taking this job, total waste of my time. Retail pharmacy is better than this hospital pharmacy job hands down.
pros: There really aren't any pros except that the cafeteria food is super cheap so you'll save money there, which you'll probably need since the salary here for hospital inpatient pharmacists is in my opinion way too low.
cons: Where do I begin? Even health insurance offered by the retail chains is better than what's offered here. 401k match is terrible. Pay is unacceptably below nationwide average for the same position at other hospitals. Techs don't give respect and the culture between your techs and other pharmacists at the inpatient pharmacy is absolutely terrible. I feel like everyone just likes to snitch back to the boss. I don't even like the boss herself since she can be utterly rude, and an unpleasant/undesirable presence to be around. If you value your time, I do not recommend working here not even to get hospital experience. you will regret it.

review_title: Great coworkers that help to make the day enjoyable.
pros: Comparatively small staff so most people know each other by name throughout the company.  Since it's a community hospital you get to know many of the patients and their families.
cons: Low pay compared to other places.  It is a small hospital so not many different departments and specialties to work in.

review_title: Terrible place to work for. Wishing I'd never accepted this position. Would definitely not recommend to ANYBODY.
pros: Paid vacation is the only pro.
cons: You're frowned upon for using your sick time when actually sick,  The management spends hundreds of thousands of dollars on this "Planetree Philosophy" when it's fully optional for the higher-ups (apparently), many get away with too much. It's not a friendly place to work at by any means. Underpaid and understaffed - just waiting to be sold (in my honest opinion). Little to no raises. No future in this company. Would not recommend. The wages and annual raises are laughable. Also, worst H.R. department I've ever come across, where you get literally zero support.

review_title: Mixed emotions. More negative than positive.
pros: PlaneTree is a great philosophy. Everyone you come in contact with is very friendly and extremely patient/visitor centered. I have been in another hospital as an inpatient and the staff were so loud and obnoxious that it was impossible to sleep and have a full recovery but when you are in Griffin we have "Quiet time" to the best ability of the staff to ensure the recovery and comfort for each individual and their family. The hospital and its staff try to make sure that the patient and the family feel like they are "at home".
cons: Wages are not competitive. More and more gets added to your job description with no compensation for any of it.

pros:
--Affordable and comprehensive benefits. 
--Good PTO. 
--Visible and accessible executive and management. 
--Employees are friendly and really believe in Planetree. 
--Hospital is clean and well-kept. 
--Orientation is a well rounded overview. 
--Great cafeteria. 
--Employees are recognized for their good work (ITIP, Success Rewards, Great Saves, etc,) 
--Free gym memberships. 
--Practice what they preach.
cons: I cannot think of any cons at the moment. Salaries are a bit lower than other area hospitals, but they are a smaller organization than most.

pros: Flexible work schedule, comfortable atmosphere, honest & approachable leadership, tuition reimbursement, little micro-management at department level.
cons: Relatively low pay, some duties inappropriately assigned, employees are sometimes "pigeonholed," increased expectations despite cutbacks to resources, contribution of certain positions often overlooked.

pros: community feel- everyone there had a good family sense to them and seemed to feel good about working there
cons: demanding schedule-- in my department there was not enough staff and so it placed a lot of strain on the employees there

pros: Very good benefits, close to home, very neat and clean place to work.  Alot of incentives. Very good cafeteria.
cons: Make less money than other hospitals.  Not enough parking for employees.  Working at a small hospital people think it is not good.
